content.question: A student connects a resistor of unknown resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to a battery of unknown voltage. The student connects a voltmeter and ammeter in the circuit to measure the current and voltage in order to determine the power <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> dissipated by the resistor. Which of the following correctly describes the ammeter or voltmeter and how it must be connected in the circuit to make accurate measurements?

choices.label: The voltmeter must have a resistance much less than <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and be placed at position <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The ammeter must have a resistance much less than <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and be placed at position <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The voltmeter must have a resistance much less than <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and be placed at position <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The ammeter must have a resistance much less than <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and be placed at position <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Both the ammeter and voltmeter must have resistances much less than <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, but can be placed at either position.

content.answer: The ammeter must have a resistance much less than <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and be placed at position <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
